Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in April with my daughter and had a wonderful holiday. Our room was one of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in and was thoroughly cleaned every day - with a fresh set of fluffy towels. We were on a budget and opted to share a bathroom, which was very smart and always clean. The breakfast was great and got us off to a good start in the mornings. And the location is very good - only a short way from the stop for the airport waterbus so we didn't have any trouble carrying our suitcases, almost next to the Rialto and also just a few minutes' walk from St Mark's Square. The very best thing about this hotel was the staff. Their professional friendliness and a bit of banter made this a really enjoyable place to stay. We needed to checkout before breakfast, so they made us a picnic breakfast to take with us. I honestly don't think I have stayed at a hotel where the staff have made me feel so welcome and cared for. Thank you Hotel alla Fava!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ingebun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel all Fava for a weekend in April - had some difficulties with the booking as I tried to modified the booking from 3 people to 4 people. I thought it was fair enough that we are unable to do so. However, went to the room and we got 4 people room! However, the man in the front desk is very nice and said sorry etc, anyway our other friend has found another hotel nearby. Location is real good, walking distance to the square and the bridge. But then again, Venice is small enough, almost everywhere is walking distance... It is exceptional value considering our spacious bedroom and bathroom (maybe due to the fact it is 4 bedder not 3). PLUS our room is overlooking the water so we have this soothing sound of water splashing when we went to bed that night. Overall it is a great hotel, will definitely come back to stay here again when I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alla Fava is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Elliellathe6th
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in March and loved it. The hotel is in a very central location within walking distance to the Rialto bridge and St. Mark's. It's easy to find as well with Sara's directions. The view of the canal from our windows was spectacular. But what really made the difference was the service from ALL the staff. Everyone was so helpful and accommodating from the moment we emailed to inquire about availability right until checkout. Plus the price is very reasonable for Venice! The only 'con' is that there is no free wifi. But again, the staff is very helpful in looking up any info you need. We wanted to know about mass times and they were very quick to look it up and give us directions. Would definitely recommend staying here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The best doesn't need to be the most expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Jonas W
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Venice and a very pleasant stay at this hotel. I can really recommend this hotel. It couldn't be better located. Close to San Marco and Rialto bridge. I had to go from the train station several mornings and it took just 10 minutes from the Rialto with the vaporettos. It is beautifully laid out in a little square with a church, a ponte and the canal. Staff is wonderful, cheerful and helpful! They helped me to get some caffelatte & cornetti before they had the breakfast opened! That is service! (Talking about breakfast, it's very good! Only thing that could be improved is that the coffee is from a machine and not brewed "a casa"). They also let me use their computer to check-in on the airline home, and even print some stuff. Helped several times to find places on maps etc. Forgot my tootpaste and shaving cream home, which the helpful maid brought me at once... Very nice and clean room. Comfortable bed with like new linen. I had shared WC & shower, and it was always clean and tidy. Warm water and fresh towels every morning. A big hug to everyone at Hotel Alla Fava! I will come back for shure! Ci vediamo ragazzi! /Jonas

Reviews.Title: “Endearing little hotel near the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Sophia_Nagy
Reviews.Content: Fava has been one of the best things happening to us on our off-season Venice jolly! The place is good value, very central yet quiet (as far as an early March weekend goes) with young and super-nice staff at your service. Our room was small but comfortable and well-equipped. Nice view to the tiny square and the nearby little canal/bridge. The whole space exuded that classic Venetian charm. A+ for a tasty, hearty breakfast with perfect coffee and those fresh croissants near the self-service croissant/toast oven - well, fancy that! Absolutely loved our stay there, will definitely return from Budapest next year. Only downside/request: we could have used some free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Samrat S
Reviews.Content: As they say "bricks make house and people make it home" same way "rooms make hotel and staff makes it wonderful experience". i have been to many five star hotels & properties around the world but staff here is at par with staff at any five star hotels and they make all efforts to make your stay not only nice but wonderful. Hotel is situated in mid of town five min walk to Rialto and 4 min walk to San Marco. very nice and clean rooms. This time i was in venice staying in one of the five star hotel but as i have to extend travel and rooms in five star hotel were not available so i started to walk and see which hotel i can get rooms . Even though my trip was company paid upto 250 euros per day (for hotel ) and i could have stayed in any five star hotel but after visiting this hotel i decided to stay there. I love my stay over there and will definitively visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Visit January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Alex H
Reviews.Content: The staff at Alla Fava Hotel was amazing! We had another reservation at a bed and breakfast and they were so nice at helping us try to find it even though it was a competitor! When no one showed up to let us in at the B&B we went back there and got a room. The staff was so nice and helpful with any of our requests. The room was really nice and our particular room over looked one of the canals that rund through the city. They had a continental breakfast in the morning which was sooo good and better than what we get at most places in the US. I would highly recommend this place to stay. Apparently the bad reviews are due to prior management which was horrible but they now are under new management and I think it really shows. I also must say they were so much cheaper than our other place and well worth it! If you are in Venice stay here! They are well located and within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. We had such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Real Value”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the service and the friendly staff. They always helped me out with my question. The location is 2 minutes away from Rialto, 5 minutes from San Marco. I was on my own and got a clean room. Some rooms have a view, some don't. Mine didn't have. The breakfast was included and was alright (toast, jam, salami, cheese, cafe, tea, juice). I had less for breakfast in some italien hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanjeevC
Reviews.Content: Small but centrally located Hotel Near Rivolta Bridge in Venice. Walks in the Venice are easy with this Hotel stay. Clean and revamped property is a good option for bargain stay. Friendly staff. The only issue I faced was non availability of Facilites of Toilet after Checkout, which I find inhospitable.

Reviews.Title: “probably my favourite little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucy-loo-10
Reviews.Content: What a perfect little hotel! i was in venice for 3 nights, on my own because my boyfriend was sick, and i was lucky enough to stumble on this little gem. All Fava was affordable ; It was in the perfect location (between san marco and rialto) which meant you never had to wander very far ; It was tucked away off the main drag so it was nice and quiet ; The rooms were impeccably clean, and although mine was small (which is typical in europe) it was the perfect size for me ; THe room was warm and cosy ; There was a beautiful view of a canal ; The breakfast was lovely (and you could help yourself to little snacks for later in the day!) ; and the highlight - the staff - probably the friendliest and most helpful bunch of people i've come across traveling. Its the perfect hotel for the traveller! I read some of the reviews from a while back, complaining about the fact that there are only italian TV channels - and as far as i'm concerned, if you go to venice and want to sit in your room and watch TV, you're an idiot. i'd recommend this little hotel to anyone traveling to venice - except the idiot that wants to sit in a room and watch tv, you should stay at home i think!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lauren73D
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at Alla Fava and really enjoyed the experience! The location is great, very central and close to the main attractions. The hotel has a lovely view on the canal -dreamlike! The staff was friendly and helpful and the new owners made us feel at home, giving us tips on what to do and see in Venice. And where to eat! The rooms are tidy and clean and have a warm atmosphere. If I ever go back to Venice I'll be at Alla Fava!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Emilywindsor
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were staying in Venice for just one night and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The room was beautiful, very clean and so comfortable. Breakfast was great as well. The location is amazing, smack bang in between the Rialto bridge and San marco square yet down a lovely little side street away from the hustle and bustle of the city. What we most loved about alla fava though was the staff, they were so so friendly and welcoming and helped us with everything they could. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: KifeH
Reviews.Content: The room was reasonable, and since we are in Venice, I understand some things. however the bathroom was equipped with a pump to suck water, it broke down twice and sewage discharged into the ground at that time called the receptionist, who gave a look and told us that now was well and nothing more. we are looking at one another, since not even deigned to bring a mop to clean and the smell was becoming unbearable, yet we insist and after, a second employee there deigned to clean, but the smell was impregnated. every time we were using the toilet or shower, the noise of the pump was intolerable and night, you could wake up half of venice. the air conditioner instead of being controlled by us, was controlled by the reception, needless to say, that in most of the time was off. The towels looked more like a piece of bed sheet, towels than in reality. found several containers of shampoo bath already used, which gave the idea that if they were not removed, the bathroom was not cleaned properly. breakfast, it was still the best part, well enough despite the fact that the dose to meet completely borderless limited to repetitions. The receptionist was not friendly or nice, and was extremely difficult to communicate with him, since he spoke English poorly. Thanks that spend most of the time out to know Venice, and only used the hotel to sleep. Finally, it remains to say that I paid â‚¬ 90 per night, when merited at most a mere 30 â‚¬, and that the name Hotel is perfectly wrong, since there are Hostels, if not most, quite superior. If he returned to Venice, he was right, that never again would be that hotel, preferring to stay in the mainland and take the train in the morning and then enjoy 48 hours of the ticket we buy.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: JAN_1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend's recommendation who stayed there three years ago. Since my friend's good recommendation was enough encouraging, we were so exited to have a nice vacation in the most beautiful city in the world, but it turned out to be exactly the opposite. We arrived in Venice around early afternoon and after calling the hotel from the train station, the receptionist wasn't able to explain us how to arrive to the hotel, neither in english nor in italian. While we arrived by our own map, we had to knock the door for more than 30 minutes, because it was locked from inside. Since we were quite enthusiastic about the whole trip, we didn't take it that much seriously. but the problem started when we found out that the room was unacceptable: two beds with shared bathroom in the corridor, instead of a double bed ensuite... It was so disappointing, because there wasn't any chance to comunicate with the receptionist about the room problem, even it wasn't the poor indian guy's fault, because this wrong accomodation was done by the responsible, who wasn't even replying to our calls when we demanded an explanation. Anyway, it's been a very bad experience and I definitely don't recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “i'll never come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: haveagoodtrip10
Reviews.Content: Situated in a secluded and dimly lit street at night is scary. The first day gave us a small room that only had two beds, a broken television and a tap with two towels. The bathroom was shared with other hotel guests. One day when we returned from sightseeing, our room had been changed by an even smaller room. They had taken our things without asking. In the new room had only one bed and a folding bed that looked like a child's bed because it was very small. We slept very badly. They did not give us any explanation, and only we were told that the hotel manager never came to the hotel and we could not talk to him. Rooms mediocre and not very clean, had some insect and the window did not close well. Every day had the same breakfast, better go to breakfast at a cafe in the city. Rooms mediocre and not very clean, had some insect and the window did not close well. Every day had the same breakfast, better go to breakfast at a cafe in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, worn hotel - but clean sheets and bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: bostongail
Reviews.Content: I had an unexpected trip to Venice, so did not do any planning, and had one night without a room. Fava had space, but coming up to it at night was scary- a very dark alley, an abandoned square, but quite close to Rialto bridge (so the feeling of 'too' quiet). The room itself was really minimal but clean, and the night went without noise or incident. Breakfast was adequate, and there were pleasant people at other tables. I couldn't help but think a bit of investment could make this place a goldmine...

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cramped”
Reviews.Author: Makena07
Reviews.Content: It was extremely difficult to find accomodations in Venice. All of the hotels recommended in guide were booked or outrageously expenseive, so we found the Alla Fava as a secondary choice. It was defintely secondary accomodations for its price, and was the least desireable hotel we stayed in during our trip. The rooms were small, dingy and thinly-walled. The air conditioning had to be turned on by the staff, at the main breaker panel, meaning it was either too hot, or way too cold overnight. The breakfast was mediocre, with few selections. There was a distinct damp odour in the hallways and hotel, presumably typical of an island city, but it was nonetheless, unattractive. The location was central, and easy to find - the hotel photos on the website are generous depictions. Expect a solid two-star stay at the Hotel Alla Fava.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return here”
Reviews.Author: LauraMarie79
Reviews.Content: From the outside, my husband and I were a little weary of the hotel. The light outside the hotel was broken, and the hotel is located in a dark corner, just off the main area. We did not have a canal view, or any view from that matter. The hotel staff were fine, though not particularly helpful, and the rooms were quiet. The location was good to see the main attractions of Venice. We also appreciated the air conditioning on a hot August day. The cleanliness was about a 7/10 and there were a handful of bugs and mosquitos flying around our room. We didn't eat the breakfast since it only consisted of a croissant, and warm juice and milk. I would not want to return to this hotel unless it was the last resort. I booked the hotel using booking.com and paid 100 E per night. I realize that you get what you pay for, but I was hoping for more. I was ready to leave this hotel after staying for 2 nights. This hotel may be ok for a night or 2, but if you are on a honeymoon or plan on spending some time in the room, I'd look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cana view!”
Reviews.Author: Jacuz
Reviews.Content: So nice little hotel with a delightful room overlooking the canal..what else? I just paid 135,00 euro per night, during high season. Perfect position, quiet but in the center just 2 minutes by feet from rialto and 5 from san marco. I reccomend it!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel alla Fava
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5525 | Campo della Fava, 30123 Venice, Italy
